meanings.sent1: After the rain, the garden is reflowering beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The rose bush is reflowering in the spring.
meanings.sent3: The garden seems to be reflowering just in time for the garden show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a garden reflowering after a long winter.
meanings.sent5: The reflowering of the cherry blossoms brought joy to all who saw them.

meanings.definition: The act of producing flowers again.
meanings.sent1: The reflowering of the plants surprised everyone in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The reflowering of the orchids was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent3: The sudden reflowering of the cacti made the botanist chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The reflowering of the garden was a colorful spectacle.
meanings.sent5: The reflowering of the daisies brought a sense of renewal to the garden.

meanings.sent1: The reflowering of the trees signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent2: The reflowering of the tulips was a sure sign of the changing season.
meanings.sent3: The reflowering of the sunflowers seemed like a cheerful dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The reflowering of the meadow painted the landscape in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The reflowering of the garden brought back memories of warmer days.
